content: One way to make good governance more tangible to the average citizen is to increase transparency and communication between government officials and the public. This can be done through a variety of means, such as holding town hall meetings, creating a government website with easily accessible information, and using social media to communicate with citizens. Additionally, involving citizens in the decision-making process through participation in committees, task forces, and other volunteer opportunities can help create a sense of ownership and engagement in governance. Another way is to create a system of measures, metrics and results that allow citizens to evaluate the performance and impact of government actions and policies.
